page.title: 01A GAZETTEER OF THE AREA
page.content: This area is set in the centre of the wooded and clay soiled Sussex Weald. It is dominated by the village of Cuckfield. The rural area is composed largely of arable crop land and deciduous woodland. Cuckfield lies 2 miles west of Haywards Heath astride the busy A272 road, which is the major east/west route through the region. A bypass for the village has been proposed to overcome the damaging effects of traffic passing through an important conservation area. Many residents make use of the fast London to Brighton railway service through Haywards Heath to commute daily to work in London. The block boasts a large regional hospital and comprehensive school with good local shopping and recreational facilities available in the village.
